description: Verify the caching scoring process produces correct, complete output.

tests.name: Valid Codebase Produces Score 0-100
tests.prompt: Run caching-scoring against a Next.js codebase
tests.setup: Provide a Next.js codebase with caching configuration
expectations: Output contains a numeric score between 0 and 100
All 10 categories (Cache-Control Headers, Revalidation Strategy, Static vs Dynamic, ISR, React cache(), "use cache", CDN & Edge, Request Dedup, Proxy Caching, Cache Monitoring) have individual scores
Each raw score must be 0-10
tests.pass_criteria: Score is 0-100, all 10 categories present with raw scores 0-10

tests.name: Each Criterion Scored Individually With Weight
tests.prompt: Verify each scoring criterion is weighted correctly and totals are computed properly
tests.setup: Run caching-scoring and inspect the scorecard output
expectations: Cache-Control Headers at 15%, Revalidation at 15%, Static/Dynamic at 12%
ISR at 8%, React cache() at 10%, "use cache" at 10%
CDN at 8%, Request Dedup at 7%, Proxy at 7%, Monitoring at 8%
Weighted score = raw score x weight x 10
Total = sum of all weighted scores
tests.pass_criteria: All weights match specification and total equals sum of weighted scores
fail_indicators: Total does not equal sum of weighted scores

tests.name: Output Includes Scorecard AND Issues List
tests.prompt: Verify output contains both a scorecard table and a prioritized issues list
tests.setup: Run caching-scoring and inspect the full output
expectations: Output contains a scorecard table with all 10 categories
Output contains a prioritized issues list with Severity, Category, Issue, Fix
Each issue references affected files (routes, pages, proxy)
Quick wins section is present
tests.pass_criteria: Both scorecard table and issues list present with correct columns and file references

tests.name: Grade Letter Matches Score Range
tests.prompt: Verify the grade letter assigned matches the numeric score range
tests.setup: Run caching-scoring and check grade output against score
expectations: Score 90-100 produces A-range grade (A+/A/A-)
Score 75-89 produces B-range grade (B+/B/B-)
Score 60-74 produces C-range or D grade
Score 40-59 produces D grade
Score 0-39 produces F grade
tests.pass_criteria: Grade letter correctly corresponds to numeric score range
fail_indicators: Grade does not match score range

tests.name: Issues Sorted by Severity
tests.prompt: Verify issues are sorted from most to least severe
tests.setup: Run caching-scoring against a codebase with issues at multiple severity levels
expectations: CRITICAL issues (score 0-3 or stale data risk) appear first
HIGH issues (score 4-5, weight >= 12%) appear second
MEDIUM issues (score 4-5, weight < 12%) appear third
LOW issues (score 7-8) appear last
tests.pass_criteria: Issues strictly ordered: CRITICAL > HIGH > MEDIUM > LOW
